### Alliaria petiolata

$$\begin{bmatrix}
    s_b & 0 & f * V * (1 - g_i) \\
    g_b & 0 & f * v * g_i \\
    0 & s & 0
    \end{bmatrix}$$
    
    
### Carduus nutans

$$\begin{bmatrix}
    S_{b} & 0 & f * e \\
    g_{b} & 0 & f * g_{i} \\
    0 & s_{j} & 0
    \end{bmatrix}$$ 
    
    
### Draba verna

$$\begin{bmatrix}
    0 & v_{3} * (1 - g_{i}) & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
    0 & 0 & v_{2} * (1-g_{i}) & 0 & 0 \\
    0 & 0 & 0 & v_{1} * (1- g_{i}) & 0 \\
    0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & s * f * v_{0} * (1-g_{i}) \\ 
    v_{4} * g_{i} & v_{3} * g_{i} & v_{2} * g_{i} &
    v_{1} * g_{i} &  s * f * v_{0} * g_{i}
  \end{bmatrix}$$
  
^^ This one seems a little out of place w/ respect to the way we did Kummerowia for example. Can you double check this one? I think it's an equally legitimate alternative way of modeling seed bank transitions (i.e. if you don't germinate, you become a year older in the seed bank), but it just seems odd we chose to do it this way here and a different way below.



### Kummerowia striata

$$\begin{bmatrix}
    0 & 0 & f * v * g_{b_2} \\
    1 & 0 & f * v * g_{b_1} \\
    0 & 1 & s * f * v * g_{i}
\end{bmatrix}$$


### Lepidium campestre

$$\begin{bmatrix}
    s * f * g_i 
\end{bmatrix}$$

### Lespedeza cuneata

$$\begin{bmatrix}
    0 & 0 & 0 & f_{S} * (1-g) * v & f_{M} * (1-g) * v & f_{L} * (1-g) * v \\
    g * v & 0 & 0 & f_{S} * g * v & f_{M} * g * v & f_{L} * g * v \\
    0 & p_{Sdl1} * s_{Sdl} & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
    0 & p2_{Sdl1} * s_{Sdl} & p_{Sdl2} * s_{Sdl2} & s_{S} * c_{SS} & s_{M} * r_{SM} & 0 \\
    0 & 0 & 0 & s_{S} * p_{MS} & s_{M} * c_{MM} & s_{L} * r_{ML} \\
    0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & s_{M} * p_{LM} & s_{L} * c_{LL}
\end{bmatrix}$$


### Perilla frutescens

$$\begin{bmatrix} s * f * g_i  \end{bmatrix}$$

### Potentilla recta

$$\begin{bmatrix}
    s_{b} & 0 & 0 & f * v * (1-g_{i}) \\
    g_{b} & 0 & 0 & f * v * g_{i} \\
    0 & s_{1a} * s_{1b} * (1-p_{1}) & s_{2} * (1-p_{2}) & s_{3} * (1-p_{3}) \\
    0 & s_{1a} * s_{1b} * p_{1} & s_{2} * p_{2} & s_{3} * p_{3}
\end{bmatrix}$$

### Thlaspi perfoliatum

$$\begin{bmatrix} 
    s_{b} & s * f * v * (1-g_i)\\
    g_{b} & s * f * v * g_i
\end{bmatrix}$$


### Verbascum thapsus

$$\begin{bmatrix}
    s_{b} * (1-g_{b}) & 0 & f * v * (1-g_{i}) \\
    s_{b} * g_{b} & 0 & f * v * g_{i} \\
    0 & s_{j} & 0
\end{bmatrix}$$
